intro: Scaphochlamys atroviridis, commonly known as the black-veined scaphochlamys, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, lance-shaped leaves with dark green veins. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
